name: mris_volmask
description: Computes a volume mask, at the same resolution as the <subject>/mri/brain.mgz. The volume mask contains 4 values: LH_WM (default 10), LH_GM (default 100), RH_WM (default 20), RH_GM (default 200).

inputs.name: Positional IO argument
inputs.description: Positional argument that represents input/output settings.
Maximum distance up to which the signed distance function computation is accurate.
inputs.name: Cap Distance

inputs.description: Override default value for background label value (0).
inputs.name: Label Background

inputs.description: Override default value for left white matter label (20).
inputs.name: Label Left White

inputs.description: Override default value for left ribbon label (10).
inputs.name: Label Left Ribbon

inputs.description: Override default value for right white matter label (120).
inputs.name: Label Right White

inputs.description: Override default value for right ribbon label (110).
inputs.name: Label Right Ribbon

inputs.description: Surface root name (e.g. <subject>/surf/$hemi.<NAME> - default value is white).
inputs.name: Surface White

inputs.description: Surface root name (e.g. <subject>/surf/$hemi.<NAME> - default value is pial).
inputs.name: Surface Pial

inputs.description: Specify a different name for the aseg input file (default is aseg).
inputs.name: ASEG Name

inputs.description: Output root name (default is ribbon). Output files would be, for example, mri/ribbon.mgz.
inputs.name: Output Root

inputs.description: Specify SUBJECTS_DIR, default is read from environment.
inputs.name: Subjects Directory

inputs.description: Save the signed distance function as ?h.dwhite.mgz and ?h.dpial.mgz.
inputs.name: Save Distance Function

inputs.description: Run hemispheres in parallel and combine the result.
inputs.name: Parallel Processing

inputs.description: Edit the aseg using the ribbons and save to aseg.ribbon.mgz.
inputs.name: Edit ASEG

inputs.description: Save just the ribbon for the hemispheres - in the format ?h.ribbon.mgz.
inputs.name: Save Ribbon

author: FreeSurfer Developers
